page.title: 13Quarrying
page.content:
A visitor going to a modern quarry on Portland would find channelling machines moving to and fro on their short tracks cutting furrows in the solid rock, enormous cranes swinging huge blocks from place to place and then big machines carrying the blocks away for cutting. Occasionally explosions can be heard which are followed by splinters of rock filling the air. The sound of thudding drills and heavy hammers wielded by brawny arms can always be heard. rectangular masses of stone weighing many tonnes are loosened from the mother rock, then great big cranes load them onto trucks which take then to the stone mill. The blocks of limestone are shaped for building purposes or crushed to make road chippings.
Michelle Carr, aged 14
